confrontation: ^Aslan: Release the shepherd, for he has done no wrong that warrants such wrath.
^Bunny Lady: Ah, the mighty Aslan comes forth. Your cage was comfortable, wasn't it?

c-0: ^ Aslan: Cedric acted out of courage and compassion. Such virtues should be rewarded, not punished.
^Bunny Lady: Virtues? In my kingdom, power is the only virtue. And you, Aslan, have lost yours.
c-1: ^ Aslan: He is but a child of the land, acting upon the laws of old. Show mercy, as befits a queen.
^Bunny Lady: Mercy is for the weak. But perhaps... there is a game to play here.

c-0: ^ Aslan: I may not have my former power, but my voice still commands many.
^Bunny Lady: Commands many, but controls none. Your roar is silent here, Aslan.
c-1: ^ Aslan: What is it you desire? I will take the shepherd's place.
^Bunny Lady: Tempting, but what use have I for a toothless lion?

c-0: ^ Aslan: I can offer you counsel, wisdom of ages past.
^Bunny Lady: Wisdom does not protect thrones. Power does.
c-1: ^ Aslan: There must be something you desire. Name it, and spare the boy.
^Bunny Lady: What I desire... is your acknowledgment of my reign. Swear fealty, and he goes free.

c-0: ^ Aslan: If it will save Cedric, I accept your terms.
c-1: ^ Aslan: Never will I bow to tyranny.

AcceptTerms: ^Bunny Lady: Wise choice, Aslan. I accept your submission.
RefuseTerms: ^Bunny Lady: Then you leave me no choice. Guards!

c-0: ^ Bunny Lady: Take your shepherd and leave my sight.
^Aslan: Come, Cedric. You are safe now.
^ Bunny Lady: Take them both away!
^Aslan: Fear not, Cedric. This is not the end.
